title: President Joe Biden Farewell Address Live Updates: Biden ends farewell address on optimistic note urging Americans to ‘stand guard’ - The Indian Express
summary:
President Joe Biden Farewell Address Live Updates: Biden ends farewell address on optimistic note urging Americans to ‘stand guard’

Date: Wednesday night (local time)

Source: Indian Express

In his farewell address, President Biden called for Americans to stand guard against a growing “oligarchy” while reflecting on his legacy and recent diplomatic efforts.

  • Biden's farewell address was broadcast live at 8 pm ET from the Oval Office.
  • The address follows Biden's announcement six months ago that he would not seek re-election.
  • He led efforts to finalize a historic ceasefire between Israel and Hamas.
  • Biden endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris as the Democratic candidate for the upcoming presidential election.
  • In his farewell letter, he expressed gratitude for serving the nation for over 50 years.
“It has been the privilege of my life to serve this nation for over 50 years.”

The address resonated as a mixture of optimism and acknowledgment of the challenges facing the nation.
newTitle: President Joe Biden's Farewell Address: A Call to Stand Guard

title: 20,000 Indian students landed in Canada but failed to show up at colleges last year - The Indian Express
summary:
20,000 Indian Students Fail to Show Up at Canadian Colleges

Date: January 16, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

Indian students constituted a significant portion of the nearly 50,000 international students reported as 'no-shows' at Canadian colleges and universities. Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) reported that almost 20,000 of these no-shows were from India, representing 5.4 percent of the total Indian students tracked.

  • Non-compliant international students accounted for 6.9% of all study permit holders.
  • Students from 144 countries were tracked, with varying non-compliance rates.
  • India's non-compliance rate was significant, with an investigation into links between colleges and illegal migration.
  • Calls for stricter rules and greater transparency in the international student system.
Henry Lotin, immigration expert: 'Most non-compliant Indian students likely remained in Canada, working while aiming for permanent residency.'

This situation emphasizes the need for improvements in data collection and regulatory measures to ensure compliance among international students in Canada.
newTitle: 20,000 Indian Students Fail to Show Up at Canadian Colleges

title: Joe Biden farewell speech live updates: President says 'Americans buried under avalanche of disinformation’ - Hindustan Times

summary:
Michelle Obama Skips Trump Inauguration Amid Divorce Rumors

Speculation is mounting regarding Barack and Michelle Obama's relationship as the former first lady will not attend Donald Trump's inauguration.

  • Michelle Obama has previously skipped official events, including Jimmy Carter's funeral.
  • The decision to miss the inauguration is seen as breaking tradition.
  • Social media is rife with rumors and speculation about the couple's relationship status.
“I think Barack and Michelle Obama are heading for divorce,” commented an X user.

The absence of Michelle at significant gatherings raises questions about their long-standing relationship.

title: India welcomes Israel-Hamas ceasefire deal, calls for sustained humanitarian assistance in Gaza - The Hindu
summary:
India Welcomes Ceasefire Deal Between Israel and Hamas

Publication Date: January 16, 2025

Source: The Hindu

India has expressed its support for the ceasefire and hostage-release deal reached between Israel and Hamas. The Ministry of External Affairs emphasized the importance of continued humanitarian assistance for the people of Gaza.

  • India's MEA welcomes the ceasefire and hostage-release agreement.
  • The MEA hopes the deal will ensure ongoing humanitarian assistance to Gaza.
  • Qatar and the United States facilitated the announcement of the ceasefire deal.
  • The ceasefire is expected to go into effect on Sunday.
  • Outgoing U.S. President Joe Biden remarked on the significance of the negotiations.
  • Hamas described the ceasefire as a victory for the Palestinian resistance.
“We welcome the announcement of the agreement for the release of hostages and a ceasefire in Gaza.” - MEA

This ceasefire may signify a critical point for peace efforts in the region, provided it leads to sustained humanitarian aid and dialogue.
newTitle: India Welcomes Ceasefire Deal Between Israel and Hamas

title: 'Consistently called for release of hostages': India issues statement on Israel-Hamas ceasefire in Gaza - The Times of India
summary:
India Calls for Release of Hostages Amid Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Discussions

Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

India has issued a statement urging for the release of hostages in Gaza as ceasefire negotiations continue between Israel and Hamas.

  • India emphasizes the importance of humanitarian considerations in the conflict.
  • The statement highlights India's call for peaceful resolution and assistance to affected civilians.
  • Diplomatic channels are being engaged to facilitate discussions.
"We consistently call for the release of all hostages to ensure peace in the region." - Indian Government Statement

This statement underscores India's commitment to supporting peace efforts in ongoing conflicts and aligns with international calls for resolution.
newTitle: India Calls for Release of Hostages Amid Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Discussions

title: Israel-Hamas ceasefire live updates: Israel escalates bombardment on Gaza amid truce deal announcement - Hindustan Times
summary:
Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Live Updates: Escalation of Bombardment Amid Truce Deal

Date: January 16, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The United States, Egypt, and Qatar have been mediating an end to the war sparked by Hamas' attack on Israel in October 2023. While a significant ceasefire agreement is announced, Israeli bombardment on Gaza continues.

  • A ceasefire agreement is reportedly close, but final details are being worked out by Israeli PM Netanyahu.
  • Qatar's PM confirmed a ceasefire in Gaza will begin soon, with 33 Israeli hostages released in the first phase.
  • The war has resulted in significant casualties: 46,707 deaths in Gaza, predominantly civilians, and 1,210 deaths in Israel, mostly civilians.
  • ISRAEL launched airstrikes resulting in 13 Palestinian casualties in recent hours.
“It is critical that everybody – that the outgoing Biden administration lays the groundwork for the incoming Trump administration...” - Jon Polin, family member of a hostage.

The situation remains tense as both sides prepare for potential ceasing of hostilities.
newTitle: Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Live Updates: Escalation of Bombardment Amid Truce Deal

title: Bryan Johnson, are you taking notes? 124-year-old Chinese woman shares secrets to longevity - Hindustan Times
summary:
124-Year-Old Chinese Woman Shares Secrets to Longevity

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Qiu Chaishi, who recently celebrated her 124th birthday, shares her insights on longevity and a fulfilling life. Residing in Nanchong, Sichuan Province, her life story reflects China's historical changes and her personal resilience.

  • Born in 1901, Qiu has lived through significant periods in Chinese history.
  • Her family boasts six generations, underscoring her long-lasting legacy.
  • Qiu follows a strict daily routine, including meals and exercises like walking after each meal.
  • She attributes her longevity to a positive attitude and a balanced diet.
  • Living with her granddaughter, she maintains independence despite some age-related challenges.
“My siblings, husband, and son passed away long ago. The King of Hell must have forgotten about me and will not take me!” - Qiu Chaishi

Her story encourages many, emphasizing a peaceful mindset as crucial for a long life.
newTitle: 124-Year-Old Chinese Woman Shares Secrets to Longevity

title: A Prime Minister got down on one knee for Giorgia Meloni, surprised her with scarf on birthday. Watch - Hindustan Times
summary:
Albanian Prime Minister Edi Rama Surprises Giorgia Meloni on Her 48th Birthday

Date: Jan 16, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Albanian Prime Minister Edi Rama surprised Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni by presenting her with a scarf and singing to her on her 48th birthday during the World Future Energy Summit in Abu Dhabi.

  • Rama went down on one knee to hand over the gift and serenade Meloni.
  • The scarf was designed by an Italian designer who has moved to Albania.
  • Despite their differing political backgrounds, the two leaders maintain a strong working relationship.
  • They have collaborated on migration issues, including an agreement to send some migrants to detention centers in Albania.
  • Italy, Albania, and the UAE signed a €1 billion deal for renewable energy at the summit.
“Tanti auguri” (happy birthday) - Edi Rama

This celebratory gesture exemplifies the camaraderie between the two leaders and their shared commitment to collaboration on energy and migration issues.
newTitle: Albanian Prime Minister Edi Rama Surprises Giorgia Meloni on Her 48th Birthday

title: Media Outlet Obtains Telegram Message Between Min Hee Jin And NewJeans Member’s Uncle - Koreaboo
summary:
Media Outlet Obtains Telegram Message Between Min Hee Jin And NewJeans Member’s Uncle

Date: 2 hours ago | Source: Koreaboo

Min Hee Jin, the former CEO of ADOR, had a conversation with the uncle of a NewJeans member via Telegram about a complaint filed against the group regarding workplace bullying.

  • The conversation took place around the time Hanni, a member of NewJeans, was allegedly bullied at work.
  • The Telegram message revealed possible violations of contract regulations by Min regarding the discussion of sensitive topics.
  • Media outlets interpret Min's words to decipher her knowledge of the petition related to the Ministry of Employment and Labor.

Mr. A: The Ministry of Employment and Labor has started. Please call me.

Min Hee Jin: I’m currently getting an IV. I’ll call you in the afternoon.

This development raises questions about potential interventions by Min in light of the bullying accusations made by fans.

title: Generation Beta is here! From Gen Z to Silent Generation - Meet the stars from every era - Hindustan Times
summary:
Generation Beta is Here: Meet the Stars from Every Era

Date: Jan 16, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

As 2025 begins, a new generation, dubbed Generation Beta, enters the world. This article explores multiple generations, showcasing the stars associated with each.

  • Generation Beta is set to grow up in a world heavily influenced by AI.
  • Generation Alpha includes celebrity children like Taimur and Jehangir.
  • Generation Z, also known as Zoomers, are marked by their strong opinions and digital nativity.
  • Millennials, or Gen Y, grew with the internet and prioritize living in the present.
  • Generation X experienced significant economic reforms and diverse cultural shifts.
  • Baby Boomers were characterized by optimism following India’s independence.
  • The Silent Generation witnessed India's struggle for independence and is defined by hard work.
“The newest kids on the block will grow up immersed in AI and environments that promote inclusivity and creativity.”

In conclusion, the emergence of Generation Beta adds a new chapter to the narrative of cultural and generational evolution in celebrity culture.
newTitle: Generation Beta is Here: Meet the Stars from Every Era

title: California man is world’s most prolific sperm donor, father to 87 children and counting - Hindustan Times
summary:
California’s Kyle Gordy, already a father to 87 children, is on track to reach 100 offspring this year.

Published on: Jan 16, 2025 09:50 AM IST | Source: Hindustan Times

Kyle Gordy, a 32-year-old from California, has fathered 87 children and aims for 100 by year’s end. He offers sperm donation free of charge, gaining a following of over 3,000 on Instagram. Despite his fame, he has no set goal on the number of children and continues to seek opportunities globally.

  • Kyle’s oldest child is now 10 years old.
  • Currently 14 children are on the way in countries like the UK and Sweden.
  • He plans trips to Japan and Ireland in 2025 for further donations.
  • Kyle has appeared on the TLC show 90 Day Fiancé.
“I love that I’ve helped all these women start families when they thought this wouldn’t be possible.” - Kyle Gordy

Gordy looks forward to expanding his family globally and finding a permanent home, potentially in Ireland.
newTitle: California Man Becomes the World's Most Prolific Sperm Donor with 87 Children

title: NASA shares photo of a ‘large, brown-eyed’ sandhill crane. This bird is special because… - Hindustan Times
summary:
NASA Shares Stunning Photo of a Unique Sandhill Crane

Published on: Jan 16, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

NASA has recently shared a striking image of a large, brown-eyed sandhill crane on its Instagram, showcasing a departure from its usual space-themed content. The photo highlights the unique habitat and importance of this bird within NASA's Kennedy Space Center ecosystem.

  • The sandhill crane is one of 1,500 species found at NASA's Kennedy Space Center.
  • This region's shallow freshwater habitats provide ideal nesting and feeding conditions for the cranes.
  • The image captures the crane with vivid blue skies and the outline of the Vehicle Assembly Building in the background.
“So beautiful and the blue sky, ready for a successful rocket day,” commented a social media user.

This post not only celebrates the beauty of wildlife but also raises awareness about the ecological diversity present at NASA facilities.
newTitle: NASA Shares Stunning Photo of a Unique Sandhill Crane

title: With Gaza deal, IMEC Corridor can become reality: Biden - The Siasat Daily
summary:
With Gaza Deal, IMEC Corridor Can Become Reality: Biden

Publication Date: Wednesday, October 2023, Source: Siasat Daily

US President Joe Biden announced that the recent ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas creates opportunities for the India-Middle East-Europe Corridor (IMEC) to become a reality. This corridor aims to enhance transportation and communication links between Europe and Asia.

  • The IMEC Corridor extends from India to Europe through the Middle East, signed by eight countries.
  • It serves as an alternative to China's One Belt, One Road Initiative.
  • The project was affected by recent tensions in the region, specifically the Hamas attack on Israel.
  • The initiative positions India strategically in global supply chains.
  • Biden highlighted the significance of this corridor for regional economic integration.
“By offering an alternative to China’s Belt and Road Initiative, this project underscores New Delhi’s proactive approach to regional economic integration and infrastructure development.”

This agreement marks a potential shift in regional collaboration and economic strategy, with lasting implications for international relations and trade.
newTitle: With Gaza Deal, IMEC Corridor Can Become Reality: Biden

title: US President Joe Biden warns of dangerous 'oligarchy', ‘extreme wealth’ in dark farewell speech - Hindustan Times
summary:
Joe Biden Warns of ‘Oligarchy’ and Extreme Wealth in Farewell Speech

Date: Jan 16, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

In his farewell address, President Joe Biden raised alarms about a dangerous concentration of power and wealth in America, citing concerns about an emerging oligarchy and a tech-industrial complex.

  • Biden highlights a worrying trend of extreme wealth concentration threatening democracy.
  • He warns of a tech-industrial complex infringing on democratic rights.
  • Biden invokes Eisenhower’s warnings about military-industrial complexes, expanding to current tech concerns.
  • Mentions the affluent supporting Trump's political rise.
  • Calls for constitutional amendments to limit presidential immunity.
“Today, an oligarchy is taking shape in America of extreme wealth, power and influence that literally threatens our entire democracy.” - Joe Biden

This speech serves as a stark warning about the growing divide and the implications for the future of American democracy.
newTitle: Joe Biden Warns of ‘Oligarchy’ and Extreme Wealth in Farewell Speech

President Joe Biden warns of dangers of ‘oligarchy’ running the U.S. in farewell address to nation - The Hindu
summary:
President Joe Biden warns of dangers of ‘oligarchy’ running the U.S. in farewell address to nation

Published on: January 16, 2025

Source: The Hindu

In his farewell address, President Biden expressed concerns about the rise of an oligarchy in the U.S. and warned against a growing tech-industrial complex that threatens democracy.

  • Biden highlighted the concentration of wealth and power in the hands of a few, calling it a threat to democracy.
  • He drew parallels to Eisenhower's warnings about the military-industrial complex, indicating concerns over the tech-industrial complex.
  • The president addressed the need for vigilance to protect freedoms amid rapid technological and economic changes.
  • Biden emphasized the importance of a peaceful transfer of power as he prepares to leave office on January 20.
  • He reflected on his five-decade political career, marking the end of his presidency and legacy.
“Today, an oligarchy is taking shape in America... Dangerous consequences if their abuse of power is left unchecked.”

Biden's speech underscores the challenges ahead as he concludes his term amidst a divided political landscape.
newTitle: Biden's Farewell Address: Warning Against Oligarchy and Tech-Industrial Complex

title: In farewell address to nation, Biden warns of dangers of ‘oligarchy’ running the U.S. - The Hindu
summary:
Biden's Farewell Address: Warning Against an Oligarchy in America

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

In his farewell address, President Joe Biden warns of an emerging oligarchy in the U.S. and a tech-industrial complex that threatens democracy and citizens' rights.

  • Biden highlights the concentration of wealth and power among a small elite as a threat to democracy.
  • He raises concerns about a potential tech-industrial complex similar to the military-industrial complex warned about by Eisenhower.
  • The address serves as a model for a peaceful transfer of power as he prepares to hand over to President-elect Donald Trump.
  • Biden mentions significant achievements during his presidency while acknowledging the challenges ahead.
  • Calls for a constitutional amendment to end presidential immunity after Supreme Court rulings that could protect Trump.
“Today, an oligarchy is taking shape in America of extreme wealth, power and influence that literally threatens our entire democracy.” - Joe Biden

This farewell address not only highlighted Biden's immediate concerns but also reflected on his long political career, concluding five decades of public service.
newTitle: Biden's Farewell Address: Warning Against an Oligarchy in America

title: Joe Biden administration thanks Donald Trump after Israel-Hamas hostage deal: ‘Crucial’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Biden Administration Acknowledges Trump's Role in Israel-Hamas Hostage Deal

Date: Jan 16, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Biden administration has publicly thanked President-elect Donald Trump for his team's involvement in brokering a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, which has been plagued by conflict since October 2023.

  • The US State Department stated that Trump's team played a critical role in facilitating the truce.
  • The deal involves a three-phase agreement aimed at releasing hostages and allowing humanitarian aid into Gaza.
  • The ceasefire is expected to pause fighting for an initial six weeks, during which negotiations will continue.
  • 46,000 lives have been claimed by the ongoing war, highlighting its devastating impact.
“It shows that when Americans are willing to work together across partisan lines… a lot can get done.” - Matthew Miller, State Department spokesperson

In closing, the involvement of both administrations underscores the significance of bipartisan cooperation in achieving peace in the region.
newTitle: Biden Administration Acknowledges Trump's Role in Israel-Hamas Hostage Deal

title: US: Trump Considers Executive Order To Stop ‘TikTok Ban’ - Gulte
summary:
Trump Considers Executive Order to Delay TikTok Ban

Published on: 4:13 am, 16 January 2025

US President-elect Donald Trump is reportedly considering an executive order that would stop the enforcement of the TikTok ban for 60 to 90 days.

  • TikTok will be banned in the US on January 19 unless the Supreme Court accepts a legal bid from its Chinese Owner ByteDance.
  • The ban will restrict app stores such as Google PlayStore and Apple App Store from allowing downloads of TikTok.
  • Current users will retain access to the app, but no new updates will leave it unusable over time.
  • Concerns about data privacy and national security are driving the US government's actions against TikTok.
“The user data collected by TikTok could be accessed by the Chinese government.”

This potential executive order may provide temporary relief for TikTok users while legal battles continue in the Supreme Court.
newTitle: Trump Considers Executive Order to Delay TikTok Ban

title: Michelle Obama is skipping Trump's inauguration because she is not 'phoney'. 'Who is she taking dig at?' - The Times of India
How US sanctions on Russia shadow fleet may impact India oil imports - The Indian Express
summary:
How US sanctions on Russia shadow fleet may impact India oil imports

Publication Date: January 2023

Source: Indian Express

The United States recently announced significant sanctions against Russia's oil trade, particularly targeting its shadow fleet, which may have considerable implications for India's crude oil imports.

  • US sanctions encompass 183 tankers and target major Russian oil companies and insurers.
  • Russia is now India's largest crude oil supplier following significant discounts offered after the war in Ukraine.
  • Indian refiners can still accept cargoes from sanctioned vessels booked prior to sanctions until March 12.
  • Experts anticipate a shift toward West Asian suppliers as the availability of tankers for Russian oil decreases.
  • Russia may need to sell oil below the Western price cap of $60 per barrel to mitigate sanctions effects.
"India is not part of the sanctions regime against Russia, but it has generally tried to avoid falling foul of them to prevent secondary US sanctions."

In conclusion, while the new sanctions are unlikely to halt Indian oil imports, they may prompt a shift towards alternative suppliers, affecting the pricing and availability of Russian oil in the near future.
newTitle: Impact of US Sanctions on Russia's Shadow Fleet on Indian Oil Imports

title: Israel’s war on Gaza: 15 months, 15 pictures - Al Jazeera English
Israel, Hamas seal ceasefire agreement; end 15-month-long Gaza war - Hindustan Times
summary:
Israel and Hamas Reach Ceasefire Agreement Ending 15-Month Conflict

Date: Jan 16, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas signals the end of a 15-month conflict that escalated after Hamas attacked Israel in October 2023. The agreement was reached after mediation efforts by the United States, Egypt, and Qatar.

  • Ceasefire will begin on Sunday.
  • 33 Israeli hostages will be released in the first phase.
  • Hamas conducted a deadly attack on Israel on October 7, 2023, resulting in 1,210 Israeli deaths.
  • 46,707 Palestinians have been killed during the conflict, mostly civilians.
  • The talks had previously faced last-minute obstacles but were resolved by Qatari mediation.
“The ceasefire agreement marks the end of a 15-month-long conflict between Israel and Hamas.”

This ceasefire is a significant development in the ongoing conflict, reflecting the complex political dynamics in the region.
newTitle: Israel and Hamas Reach Ceasefire Agreement Ending 15-Month Conflict

Russia uses 'fake nuke' Kh-55SM missiles to strike Ukraine - Bulgarian Military
summary:
Russia Deploys Kh-55SM Missiles in Strategic Air Strike Against Ukraine

Publication Date: January 15, 2025 Source: Bulgarian Military

Russia launched a complex air strike against Ukraine, utilizing Kh-55SM missiles equipped with non-explosive mock warheads as decoys.

  • The strike included 30 missiles and 47 enemy UAVs intercepted by Ukrainian forces.
  • The Kh-55SM missiles are part of a broader military strategy and were launched from the Volgograd region.
  • Ukrainian air defense systems had an 85% interception rate against conventional missiles.
  • The primary target was Ukraine’s gas infrastructure, with limited damage reported.
“Ukrainian air defense forces shot down 30 missiles and 47 enemy UAVs, while 27 others failed to reach their targets.” — Maria Drutska 🇺🇦

This air strike reflects ongoing Russian military strategies and highlights the challenges faced by Ukrainian air defenses amidst advanced missile tactics.
newTitle: Russia Deploys Kh-55SM Missiles in Strategic Air Strike Against Ukraine
